SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.common

Class DataBusinessHelper

java.lang.Object
grafioschtrader.common.DataBusinessHelper
public abstract class DataBusinessHelper extends Object
An abstract utility class providing common business logic helper methods for financial calculations, data transformations, and comparisons within the Grafioschtrader application.

This class encapsulates reusable logic related to currency conversions, transaction processing, and collection comparisons. It aims to centralize these operations to ensure consistency and reduce code duplication across different parts of the application.

    • divideMultiplyExchangeRate

      public static double divideMultiplyExchangeRate(double amount, Double currencyExRate, String sourceCurrency, String targetCurrency)

    • divideMultiplyExchangeRate

      public static double divideMultiplyExchangeRate(double amount, Double currencyExRate, String sourceCurrency, String targetCurrency, boolean forReverseCalculation)
      Converts an amount from a source currency to a target currency using a given exchange rate, with an option for reverse calculation logic.

      The method determines whether to multiply or divide by the currencyExRate based on the relationship between sourceCurrency, targetCurrency, and the implied Currencypair derived from them. The forReverseCalculation flag can invert this logic.

      Parameters:
      amount - The amount in the source currency.
      currencyExRate - The exchange rate. The interpretation depends on the currency pair and forReverseCalculation.
      sourceCurrency - The ISO code of the source currency.
      targetCurrency - The ISO code of the target currency.
      forReverseCalculation - If true, the multiplication/division logic is inverted. This might be used when the provided currencyExRate is for the inverse pair.
      Returns:
      The converted amount in the target currency. If currencyExRate is null or if source and target currencies are the same, the original amount is returned.
      See Also:
      • getCurrencypairWithSetOfFromAndTo(String, String)

    • getCurrencyExchangeRateToMainCurreny

      public static Double getCurrencyExchangeRateToMainCurreny(Transaction transaction, DateTransactionCurrencypairMap dateCurrencyMap)
      Gets the exchange rate for a transaction to convert its value to the main currency. The rate depends on the transaction type, its date, and the currencies involved (cash account currency, security currency, main currency).

      For hypothetical sell transactions, it uses the last known price of the security's currency pair. For other transactions, it attempts to find a historical price from dateCurrencyMap. If both cash account and security currencies differ from the main currency, it prioritizes the security's currency conversion, then the cash account's currency if the former fails. If the transaction involves a currency pair (idCurrencypair is not null) and one of the transaction's currencies is the main currency, the transaction's own currencyExRate is used.

      Parameters:
      transaction - The Transaction for which to determine the exchange rate.
      dateCurrencyMap - A map (DateTransactionCurrencypairMap) containing historical exchange rates and the main currency definition. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The exchange rate to convert the transaction's relevant amount to the main currency, or null if a rate cannot be determined.

    • distinctByKey

      public static <T> Predicate<T> distinctByKey(Function<? super T,Object> keyExtractor)
      Creates a Predicate that maintains state about what it has seen previously, allowing filtering of elements in a stream to keep only those that are distinct based on a given key extractor function.

      This is useful for stream operations like stream.filter(distinctByKey(MyObject::getKey)). The predicate uses a ConcurrentHashMap to store seen keys, making it thread-safe if the stream is processed in parallel (though the distinctness guarantee in parallel streams depends on the encounter order if not otherwise specified).

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input elements.
      Parameters:
      keyExtractor - A Function that extracts the key to be used for distinctness comparison.
      Returns:
      A Predicate that returns true for an element if its key has not been seen before.

    • calcDepositOnTransactionsOfCashaccount

      public static DataBusinessHelper.CashaccountTransfer calcDepositOnTransactionsOfCashaccount(Transaction transaction, Map<FromToCurrencyWithDate,Double> fromToCurrencyWithDateMap, String mainCurrency, Map<Integer,Double> exchangeRateConnectedTransactionMap, Map<FromToCurrency,Currencypair> currencypairFromToCurrencyMap)
      Calculates the cash account transfer amounts in the main currency for DEPOSIT or WITHDRAWAL transactions. This method handles various scenarios, including transactions in the main currency, transactions in foreign currencies requiring exchange rate lookups, and linked cash account transfers.
      Parameters:
      transaction - The DEPOSIT or WITHDRAWAL Transaction to process.
      fromToCurrencyWithDateMap - A map (FromToCurrencyWithDate to Double) providing historical exchange rates. Used for transactions on dates where historical data is available.
      mainCurrency - The ISO code of the portfolio's main currency.
      exchangeRateConnectedTransactionMap - A map (Integer transaction ID to Double amount) used to track amounts for linked cash account transfers. The first part of a transfer stores its calculated main currency amount (negated) with the connected transaction's ID as key. The second part retrieves this amount. Entries are removed after the second part is processed.
      currencypairFromToCurrencyMap - A map (FromToCurrency to Currencypair) providing current exchange rates (e.g., sLast). Used for transactions dated today or in the future where historical rates are not yet in fromToCurrencyWithDateMap.
      Returns:
      A CashaccountTransfer object containing the calculated amountMC (amount in main currency) and cashAccountTransactionFeeMC (transaction fee in main currency).

    • getCurrencypairWithSetOfFromAndTo

      public static Currencypair getCurrencypairWithSetOfFromAndTo(String sourceCurrency, String targetCurrency)
      Creates a Currencypair object representing the relationship between a source and a target currency. If the source and target currencies are the same, or if either is null, it returns null as no currency pair is needed or can be formed.
      Parameters:
      sourceCurrency - The ISO code of the source (from) currency.
      targetCurrency - The ISO code of the target (to) currency.
      Returns:
      A new Currencypair instance if source and target currencies are different and not null, otherwise null.

    • compareCollectionsUnSorted

      public static <T, U> boolean compareCollectionsUnSorted(Collection<T> coll1, Collection<U> coll2, BiPredicate<T,U> predicate)
      Compares two collections to determine if they contain the same elements, irrespective of their order. The comparison of individual elements is performed using the provided BiPredicate.

      The collections are considered equal if they have the same size and for every element in the first collection, there is at least one element in the second collection that satisfies the predicate, and vice-versa (implicitly, due to size check and allMatch on the first collection).

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of elements in the first collection.
      U - The type of elements in the second collection.
      Parameters:
      coll1 - The first collection.
      coll2 - The second collection.
      predicate - A BiPredicate that defines how elements from coll1 and coll2 are compared. It should return true if the two elements are considered equivalent.
      Returns:
      true if the collections are considered equal based on size and element-wise predicate matching, false otherwise.

    • compareCollectionsSorted

      public static <T, U> boolean compareCollectionsSorted(List<T> coll1, List<U> coll2, BiPredicate<T,U> predicate)
      Compares two lists to determine if they contain the same elements in the same order. The comparison of individual elements at corresponding positions is performed using the provided BiPredicate.

      The lists are considered equal if they have the same size and for every index i, the element coll1.get(i) and coll2.get(i) satisfy the predicate.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of elements in the first list.
      U - The type of elements in the second list.
      Parameters:
      coll1 - The first list.
      coll2 - The second list.
      predicate - A BiPredicate that defines how elements from coll1 and coll2 at the same position are compared. It should return true if the two elements are considered equivalent.
      Returns:
      true if the lists are considered equal based on size and ordered element-wise predicate matching, false otherwise.
